header.gameNote: NEW YORK LIFE ACC MEN'S TOURNAMENT - 1ST ROUND

articles.description: Kyle Guy and No. 1 Virginia looked like healthy favorites in their postseason debut, beating Louisville 75-58 on Thursday in the quarterfinals of the Atlantic Coast Conference Tournament.
articles.headline: Guy scores 19, No. 1 Virginia tops Louisville in ACC tourney

images.caption: Devon Hall gets the ball in the corner and makes a quick move to the basket for a layup.
images.name: Hall drives baseline for layup

articles.description: Trevon Bluiett scored 27 points, Kaiser Gates had 16 and No. 3 Xavier looked every bit the top seed in the Big East Tournament in an 88-60 win over St. John's on Thursday.
articles.headline: Bluiett sparks No. 3 Xavier in Big East win over St. John's

images.caption: St. John's Bashir Ahmed and Xavier's Tyrique Jones exchange words after the Red Storm loses 88-60 to the Musketeers.
images.name: Xavier and St. John's get chippy during postgame hand shakes

articles.description: After going winless in ACC play this season, Pittsburgh has fired head coach Kevin Stallings, leaving the program at a crossroads.
articles.headline: What went wrong for Stallings in Pittsburgh?

images.caption: After going winless in ACC play this season, Pittsburgh has fired head coach Kevin Stallings, leaving the program at a crossroads.
images.name: What went wrong for Stallings in Pittsburgh?

articles.description: Jeremy Harris scored a career-high 27 points, CJ Massinburg added 18 and top-seeded Buffalo held off eighth-seeded Central Michigan's rally in the second half for a 89-74 win in the quarterfinals of the Mid-American Conference Tournament on Thursday.
articles.headline: Harris scores 27, top-seeded Buffalo advances in MAC tourney

articles.description: Notre Dame has a big opportunity Thursday at the ACC Tournament. A win will go a long way in helping the Fighting Irish make a case to be included in the NCAA tournament.
articles.headline: Bubble Watch: Notre Dame's big moment

images.caption: Matt Farrell and Bonzie Colson helped keep Notre Dame in contention for a bid with a win over Virginia Tech.
images.name: Matt Farrell [608x342]

images.caption: Take a look back at this season's buzzer-beaters to get ready for what Champ Week and the NCAA tournament could bring.
images.name: Relive this season's exhilarating buzzer-beaters

articles.description: Devon Hall gets the ball in the corner and makes a quick move to the basket for a layup.

images.name: Devon Hall gets the ball in the corner and makes a quick move to the basket for a layup.

videos.description: Notre Dame's Rex Pfluger uses the crossover to create space and sink the open three.
videos.headline: Pfluger crosses over to nail the 3

videos.description: Notre Dame's Bonzie Colson comes up strong at the rim, rejecting Pittsburgh's Shamiel Stevenson's layup attempt.
videos.headline: Colson 'cancels' Pitt's attempt

videos.description: Notre Dame head coach Mike Brey praises his team's dominant first half against Pittsburgh.
videos.headline: Brey: 'We love playing in Brooklyn'

videos.description: Notre Dame's Bonzie Colson makes his third block of the game, with a huge swat against Pittsburgh's Parker Stewart.
videos.headline: Colson comes up with another block

videos.description: Pittsburgh's Marcus Carr drives and makes a layup through a foul.
videos.headline: Pitt's Carr 'carving up the D'

videos.description: During a timeout, Pittsburgh's head coach Kevin Stallings attempts to break the clipboard over his knee, but fails in doing so.
videos.headline: Stallings unleashes frustration on clipboard

videos.description: Notre Dame's Bonzie Colson says he feels good after returning from injury in the Fighting Irish's close win over Pittsburgh.
videos.headline: Colson: 'I'm back'
